title: 2d6
description: Simulates rolling and adding up two six-sided dice. In other words a 2d6 roll generates a number between 2 and 12.

title: Accuracy
description:
Accuracy is added to an attacker’s Attack Roll when trying to hit an opponent. 

Accuracy is typically derived from a weapon’s quality.

title: Armor Piercing
description: An attack that is Armor Piercing ignores the target’s Soak value. This means that the damage is not reduced by armor.

title: Attack Roll
description:
The Attack Roll is calulated in the following way: 

2d6 + 
Melee To Hit / Ranged To Hit + 
Misc. Bonuses +
Accuracy Bonuses

title: Attunement per Level
description: Indicates how much of the game’s Magic resource, Attunement, is gained every time the character levels up.

title: Backstab
description:
A character that has activated the Ability to Backstab will automatically perform Backstabbing Attacks against opponents that are either Flanked or Vulnerable. 

A successful Backstab Attack adds the character’s Backstab Bonus Multiplied by the Weapon’s Crit Modifier to the damage roll.

title: Cascade
description:
Each spell has a Cascade Difficulty. When casting a spell, the caster tests their Spell Aptitude test against the Cascade Difficulty of the spell. If they succeed, they get to take another action. If they fail their turn ends. 

This allows casters to chain spells together. 

A caster can cascade a number of spells together equal to their Max Cascade attribute.

title: Charging
description:
Moving at least 2 tiles in a straight line before performing an attack allows characters with a Melee weapon to perform a Charge Attack.

Charge attacks add a bonus to your hit chance depending on how far you manage to move before attacking.

title: Critical Hit
description:
For each successful Attack, there is a chance the Hit is upgraded to a Critical Hit. This is a percentage chance equal to the attacker’s Crit Chance Attribute.

If a Critical Hit is confirmed, the Damage dealt is multiplied by the Weapon’s Crit. value.

For instance a Weapon with a Crit. value of x2, multiplies the Damage dealt in a Critical Hit by 2

title: Defence Roll
description:
The Defence Roll is:  

2d6 + 
Misc Bonuses +
Dodge

title: Development Points
description: Development Points are gained when leveling up and used to buy ranks in Feats. This unlocks new Abilities for the Character making them more powerful.

title: Difficulty
description: The Difficulty Class or DC of a test is the number a character must roll equal to or higher than to succeed.

title: Disengage
description: If a character who is within melee range of an active opponent tries to move away, they Disengage. Normally this means the Disengaging character immediately ends their turn.

title: Encumbrance
description:
Encumbrance is a measure of how much your armor and equipment reduces your ability to act freely.

Different item slots affect different skills:

Armor affects Dodge, Stealth and Athletics.
Headwear and helmets affect Awareness.
Gloves affect Thievery.
Footwear affects Stealth. 

Examine the different Attributes under the ‘Attributes’ tab to see if, and how much they are being affected by items worn.

title: Flanking
description:
A character can be Flanked if opponents occupy the tile above and below it or to the left and right of it. 

Attacking a Flanked target allows the Attacker to add their Flanking Bonus to the Attack Roll.

Rogues may Backstab Flanked Characters

title: Initiative Order
description:
Every Combat Encounter begins with all combatants making an Initiative Roll. This is calculated by adding 2d6 to the character’s Initiative Attribute. Characters then act in descending order of initiative.

Characters who are not alert as combat begins gain a severe penalty to their Initiative Roll.

title: Main Attribute
description: The Main Attribute is the Attribute that is the most important for this Class.

title: Saving Throw
description: A Saving Throw is a roll using an Attribute against some Difficulty number to avoid receiving or canceling some ongoing negative effect.

title: Silenced
description: A character with this status tag cannot use, or be affected by, Abilities or Spells that require them to be able to speak.

title: Soak
description:
Soak is a measure of damage absorption. It is usually conferred by Armor. Some creatures also have natural Soak due to thick hides. 

For every physical attack scored on the character, the damage is reduced by a random amount ranging from 0 to the character’s combined Soak.

See also: Armor Piercing.

title: Spell Tier
description: By studying different Schools of Spellcasting, a character gains Spell Tiers in that School. Spell Tiers qualify a character to learn spells and different spells have different Tier requirements.

title: Status Tags
description: Status Tags are conferred by Conditions and used by the system to dictate player behavior.

title: Afraid
description: Characters who are afraid are more susceptible to panicking.

title: Asleep
description: A character with this status tag is Vulnerable and does not act during their combat turn. Sleeping characters are much easier to sneak past and surprise.

title: Bleeding
description: A character with this status tag will take a random amount of damage at the start of each turn ranging from 1 to 10% of their Maximum Vitality until the Bleeding is stopped.

title: Blindness
description: A character with this status tag cannot use, or be affected by, Abilities or Spells that require them to see.

title: Charmed
description: A character with this status tag does not act during their turn.

title: Confusion
description: A character with this status tag does not act during their turn.

title: Deafness
description: A character with this status tag cannot use, or be affected by, Abilities or Spells that require them to hear.

title: Defenceless
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character cannot defend themselves. A Defenseless character is Vulnerable.

title: Defending
description:
A Status Tag indicating that the character spends their entire combat turn fighting defensively. 

They take no other actions and add their Defend Bonus attribute to their Dodge Attribute when making Defence Rolls.

title: Disease
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character is affected by one or more diseases.

title: FlatFooted
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character is off their guard. As such they are Vulnerable.

title: Immobile
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character cannot move around. They may still be able to take other actions and fight but are nonetheless Vulnerable.

title: Insanity
description: A character with this status tag does not act in their combat turn.

title: Intoxicated
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character has become #Intoxicated by drugs or alcohol.

title: Invisible
description: A character with this status tag will not be spotted until they attack an opponent or use a spell or ability.

title: Marked
description: This status tag typically interacts with other abilities.

title: Occupied
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character is not able to act during their combat turn.

title: Paralysis
description: A Status Tag indicating that the character is unable to move or act in any way. While in this state, they are Vulnerable.

title: Poison
description: A character with this status tag will take a random amount of damage at the start of each turn ranging from 1 to 10% of their Maximum Vitality until the Poisoning is cured.

title: Stun
description: A character with this status tag cannot act during their combat turn. They are also vulnerable for the duration.

title: To-Hit Roll
description: The To-Hit roll is made by comparing the Attacker’s Attack Roll to the Defender’s Defence Roll. If the Attacker rolls equal to or higher than the Defence Roll the attack is a hit.
notes: To Hit,to hit roll,to hit rolls,To-Hit,to-hit roll,to-hit rolls

title: Tough.
description: Short for Toughness.

title: Vitality per Level
description: Indicates how much of the game’s Hitpoint resource, Vitality, is gained every time the character levels up.

title: Vulnerable
description: A Vulnerable character cannot defend themselves. This makes them much easier to hit and it also means they can be Backstabbed.

title: Will.
description: See Willpower.
